venue.name: Microsoft New England Research & Development Center (NERD)

item.description:
Think you can't be lean in healthcare? Think again.

For April, we're bringing in Zen Chu, one of the founders of MIT's H@cking Medicine to talk about how real startups are being lean in health IT and show off some of the amazing things that have come out of Hacking Medicine. He'll also to talk about how non-life sciences folks can impact health care.

In addition - Elliot Cohen, Co-Leader of Hacking Medicine, and Julia Winn will talk about their own startups which came out of Hacking Medicine:

 

Elliot Cohen, PillPack

PillPack is an online pharmacy. We use design and technology to make it easier to manage and take your medications. Elliot will be discussing how to run lean in a regulated space with significant startup costs.

 

 

 

In addition, we'll hear from a couple of the other teams that have come out of Hacking Medicine:

  • Joe Blewitt, Epion Health - Epion Health is leveraging the power of mobile devices at the point of care to deliver interactive solutions to both patients and providers.
  • Gabriel Malseptic, SQ - SQ wants to eliminate STIs and improve individual and public health by providing a simple, safe, and secure mobile application for individuals to share their sexual health information.
item.name: Hacking Medicine: Lean in Health IT
